data.name: Is this event within this time?
data.description:
Your task is to return an array of events (determined by start and end time) which will be displayed in a calendar app, if they fall within the  given time space (again determined by start and end).

The aim of this Kata is to think about the mathematical problem, not a particular function.

- End time is always higher or equal to start time
- Events might be empty
- Start and End time of time space are always set to positive value
- The order of events in array does not matter

Ascii art thing for better imagination of our problem:
```
[---] <- Event

      |                  |        
      | [-----]          |          True
  [---|------------------|------]   True
      |                  | [----]   False
    [-|---]              |          True
      |           [------|---]      True
      |                  [----]     True
 [--] |                  |          False
      |                  |
    start               end
```


Variables:
```
  start: integer - start time of the time space
  end: integer - end time of the time space
  events: array of events, where event consists of
    a: integer - start of an event
    b: integer - end of an event
```

E.g: 
```
  withinTime(0, 10, [[5, 17],[0, 12], [10, 12]]) returns -> [[5, 17],[0, 12], [10, 12]]
  withinTime(0, 9, []) returns -> []
  withinTime(0, 5, [[6, 47],[0, 0], [6, 12]]) returns -> [[0, 0]]
```

Bonus:
- You are able to write this as a one-liner. Try your best ^.^
